docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This service facilitates communication between UCloud and Claaudia OpenStack. In UCloud terms, this is a compute provider, that provides a compute service to UCloud. It is a stateless service with an API based on this example: UCloud Spring Boot Example

It implements this interface: JvmProviderSupport

See UClouds Compute Provider Documentation

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
Service documentation on code level

This documentation is generated with Dokka:

./gradlew dokkaGfm

docs.title: Technology
docs.text: The service is built with Kotlin and Spring Boot. It uses the gradle build tool

docs.title: Swagger
docs.text:
The swagger ui can be reached at the base url. Authentication is enabled, and a Bearer token can be added using the "Authorize" button. The API can also be tested directly with cURL. The autogenerated requests for many of the endpoints cannot be shown. I have included examples of requests here to test the provider API.

For the manual insertion endpoint there is an example here.

docs.title: Authentication and Authorization
docs.text: UCloud and the provider This is handled by UClouds provider integration module: Jvm-Provider-Support A certificate and a refresh_token is added to the config and used to authenticate the provider integration module on inbound and outbound requests. See more here: UCloud Compute Providers

docs.title: API
docs.text: The gateway currently exposes the following endpoints for ucloud:

docs.title: Create
docs.text:
Start one or more compute jobs by creating stacks in openstack

One or more jobs are received from ucloud and is assumed to be ready to start. The ucloud jobs are converted to openstack stack format and sent to openstack. Without waiting for the stacks to start respond to ucloud.

A monitoring thread is started for each stack that will send a status update to ucloud when you stack has successfully started or failed.

docs.title: Sequence diagram for the create flow
Delete
docs.text:
Deletes one or more compute jobs by deleting stacks in OpenStack

The corresponding stacks are found in OpenStack and delete requests are sent.

docs.title: Sequence diagram for the delete flow
Extend
docs.text: Todo: Not implemented / Not applicable for virtual machines

docs.title: Suspend
docs.text:
Todo: Not implemented

This should suspend the virtual machine without deleting any of its resources

docs.title: Verify
docs.text:
Verify UClouds Job status is synchronized with openstack stack status

FIXME: Is this called for deleted ucloud jobs?

This call is periodically executed by UCloud. The expected status is compared with the actual status in OpenStack and a status update is sent if there is a difference.

If the stack could not be found in OpenStack send a status update with Job success to UCloud.

The gateway does not attempt to start the stack.

docs.title: Retrieve Products
docs.text: Provide ucloud with the available products. These are basically equivalent to openstack flavors but need to adhere to the ucloud format This includes information additional information, e.g., product is Virtual Machine

docs.title: Stack lifetime overview
docs.text: This flow illustrates how a stack lifecycle can look. When created, the stack goes to the running state and is charged every 15 minutes. If the charging fails the instance of the stack is shutoff. The charge task will try to charge the stack and if successful, the instance is restarted. If the max lifetime for a shutoff instance is reached the whole stack is deleted.

docs.title: Scheduled Tasks
docs.text: Scheduled by the Spring Framework for doing maintenance and job charging

docs.title: ChargeAllStacks
docs.text:
Charges the corresponding UCloud job for all active OpenStack stacks. This is run every 15 minutes and each execution will charge each stack the amount of time since it was last charged. To keep track of this a timestamp is saved as a tag on the stack in OpenStack. We only charge stacks that have status: "CREATE_COMPLETE" or "UPDATE_COMPLETE".

  • Get the corresponding job from ucloud to make sure it exists, return if not
  • Amount to charge = time between the lastCharged timestamp and now.
  • Maintain lastCharged for each stack as a tag on the stack in openstack.
  • lastCharged is the moment the stack was charged last.
  • The first time a stack is charged, use its creation time as lastCharged

If the response from ucloud is Insufficient resources, the stacks instance is shut off.

If this stack can successfully charge later on, the instance is restarted.

docs.title: Heartbeat
docs.text: This is run every 5 minutes to add a log entry to splunk. An alarm is configured to monitor this log entry and make sure the service is running.

docs.title: cleanUpFailedStacks
docs.text: Deletes stacks that failed to create or delete. An update is sent to ucloud when delete is successful

docs.title: deleteNotChargedStacks
docs.text: Delete the stacks that are shutdown and has not been charged for a set amount of time. The time is configured under janitor in the config. deleteShutoffInstanceAfterDays is the default number of days a stack can have a shutoff instance before it is deleted. flavorLifetimes is flavor specific lifetimes that overrules the default.

docs.title: sendCreditDeficitUpdates
docs.text: When a stack has had its instance shutoff by failing to charge, this task will send a message to be shown on the ucloud interface. It calculates how many resources are needed to restart the instance and continue charging.

docs.title: Config

docs.title: Openstack compute flavors
docs.text:
The general compute flavors are based on deic's type1 descriptions available somewhere.

GPU instances are based on our current hardware, machines with six t4 GPUs, 256GB memory, and 64 vCPUs (2x16 core EPYCs).

Storage is based on whatever we did on our old OpenStack platform.

Pricing is just an example

Name vCPU RAM Volatile Storage GPU Price uc-general-small 4 vCPU 16 Gb 1 Tb N/A 0.34 DKK/hour uc-general-medium 8 vCPU 32 Gb 1 Tb N/A 0.68 DKK/hour uc-general-large 16 vCPU 64 Gb 1 Tb N/A 1.37 DKK/hour uc-general-xlarge 64 vCPU 256 Gb 1 Tb N/A 5.50 DKK/hour uc-t4-1 10 vCPU 40 Gb 1 Tb T4 16 Gb 8.50 DKK/hour

Start each stack creation in openstack asynchronously with createStacks. Then start a task that monitors the stacks in openstack. When they start or report an error this message and status should be sent to ucloud. dispatchToHandler [jvm]open override fun <R : Any, S : Any, E : Any> dispatchToHandler(call: CallDescription<R, S, E>, request: R, rawRequest: HttpServletRequest, rawResponse: HttpServletResponse): S dispatchToWebSocketHandler [jvm]open override fun <R : Any, S : Any, E : Any> dispatchToWebSocketHandler(ctx: UCloudWsContext<R, S, E>, request: R) extend [jvm]open override fun extend(request: BulkRequest<JobsProviderExtendRequestItem>): BulkResponse<Unit>This currently has no use for Virtual Machines and does nothing. follow [jvm]open override fun follow(request: JobsProviderFollowRequest, wsContext: UCloudWsContext<JobsProviderFollowRequest, JobsProviderFollowResponse, CommonErrorMessage>) handler [jvm]fun handler(request: HttpServletRequest, response: HttpServletResponse): String openInteractiveSession [jvm]open override fun openInteractiveSession(request: BulkRequest<JobsProviderOpenInteractiveSessionRequestItem>): BulkResponse<OpenSession> resume [jvm]fun resume(request: BulkRequest<Job>)Ucloud plans to implement this funtionality for VMs retrieveProducts [jvm]open override fun retrieveProducts(request: Unit): BulkResponse<ComputeSupport>Provide ucloud with the available products. docs.title: SimpleCompute
docs.text: [jvm]\ constructor(client: UCloudClient, openstackService: OpenStackService, wsDispatcher: UCloudWsDispatcher, providerProperties: ProviderProperties, uCloudProperties: UCloudProperties)

docs.title: create
docs.text:
[jvm]\ open override fun create(request: BulkRequest<Job>): BulkResponse<FindByStringId>

Create stacks in openstack from ucloud job. Start each stack creation in openstack asynchronously with createStacks. Then start a task that monitors the stacks in openstack. When they start or report an error this message and status should be sent to ucloud.

docs.title: delete
docs.text:
[jvm]\ open override fun delete(request: BulkRequest<Job>)

Delete specific stacks in openstack. It is important to make sure the ucloud jobs are charged before beeing deleted. The function chargeDeleteJobs will first send a charge request to ucloud and the start the deletion process. When an async task has been started for each job, then start a task that monitors the stacks in openstack. When they can no longer be found we assume deletion and status should be sent to ucloud.

Provide ucloud with the available products. These are basically equivalent to openstack flavors but need to adhere to the ucloud format This includes information additional information, e.g., product is Virtual Machine The UCloud category is translated to availability_zone on the flavor in openstack. All information about ComputeSupport is also hardcoded for now

docs.title: terminate
docs.text:
[jvm]\ open override fun terminate(request: BulkRequest<Job>): BulkResponse<Unit>

Delete specific stacks in openstack. It is important to make sure the ucloud jobs are charged before beeing deleted. The function chargeDeleteJobs will first send a charge request to ucloud and the start the deletion process. When an async task has been started for each job, then start a task that monitors the stacks in openstack. When they can no longer be found we assume deletion and status should be sent to ucloud.

being charged asyncMonitorCreations [jvm]fun asyncMonitorCreations(jobs: List<Job>)Start creation monitor function for each job in a list of jobs asyncMonitorDeletions [jvm]fun asyncMonitorDeletions(jobs: List<Job>)Start deletion monitor function for each job in a list of jobs asyncMonitorShutdownInstanceSendUpdate [jvm]fun asyncMonitorShutdownInstanceSendUpdate(server: Server, job: Job, period: Long) asyncMonitorStackResumes [jvm]fun asyncMonitorStackResumes(jobs: List<Job>) asyncMonitorStackSuspensions [jvm]fun asyncMonitorStackSuspensions(jobs: List<Job>) asyncMonitorStartInstanceSendUpdate [jvm]fun asyncMonitorStartInstanceSendUpdate(server: Server, job: Job) asyncStackCreation [jvm]fun asyncStackCreation(job: Job, template: Template)Parse parameters from the ucloud job, send parameters and template to openstack in a createStack request attackVolumeToInstance [jvm]fun attackVolumeToInstance(instance: Server, volume: Volume) calculatePeriodAndNewChargeTimeForProduct [jvm]fun calculatePeriodAndNewChargeTimeForProduct(product: Product, stack: Stack): Pair<Long, Instant> chargeAllStacks [jvm]fun chargeAllStacks()For each stack in openstack, charge the corresponding job in ucloud. chargeCreditsJob [jvm]fun chargeCreditsJob(jobId: String, lastChargedTime: String, cpuCores: Long, period: Long): ResourceChargeCreditsResponse chargeDeleteJobs [jvm]fun chargeDeleteJobs(jobs: List<Job>) chargeJob [jvm]fun chargeJob(job: Job, stack: Stack, instance: Server, period: Long, cpuCores: Int, newChargeTime: Instant) chargeStack [jvm]fun chargeStack(stack: Stack)Charge stack by calling JobControl.chargeCredits checkCreditsJob [jvm]fun checkCreditsJob(jobId: String, lastChargedTime: String, cpuCores: Long, period: Long): ResourceChargeCreditsResponse createStack [jvm]fun createStack(name: String, template: String, parameters: MutableMap<String, String>)Send a stack creation request to openstack. Use the openstack4j builder to create the request and send it to openstack We don't return anything here because, since tasks are started to monitor the creation. createStacks [jvm]fun createStacks(jobs: List<Job>)Start the process of creating stacks from ucloud jobs For now, we use a single template, but this can change in the future. For each job start an asynchronous task createVolume [jvm]fun createVolume(name: String, description: String, size: Int) deattachVolumeToInstance [jvm]fun deattachVolumeToInstance(instance: Server, volume: Volume) deleteJob [jvm]fun deleteJob(job: Job)Takes a job and finds the corresponding stack then sends a stack delete request to openstack. deleteNotChargedStacks [jvm]fun deleteNotChargedStacks() deleteVolume [jvm]fun deleteVolume(id: String) estimateProductPriceForPeriod [jvm]fun estimateProductPriceForPeriod(job: Job, period: Long): Double? findStackIncludeDeleted [jvm]fun findStackIncludeDeleted(job: Job): Stack? getActiveStacks [jvm]fun getActiveStacks(): List<Stack> getConsole [jvm]fun getConsole(serverId: String): VNCConsole? getFlavorById [jvm]fun getFlavorById(id: String?): Flavor? getFlavorByName [jvm]fun getFlavorByName(name: String?): Flavor? getFlavorExtraSpecs [jvm]fun getFlavorExtraSpecs(id: String?): MutableMap<String, String> getImage [jvm]fun getImage(id: String?): Image? getInstanceFromId [jvm]fun getInstanceFromId(id: String): Server? getInstanceFromStack [jvm]fun getInstanceFromStack(stack: Stack): Server? getLastChargedFromStack [jvm]fun getLastChargedFromStack(stack: Stack): InstantRetrieve lastCharged timestamp from stack in openstack getSecurityGroup [jvm]fun getSecurityGroup(id: String?): SecurityGroup? getStackByJob [jvm]fun getStackByJob(job: Job, includeDeleted: Boolean = false): Stack?Retrieve corresponding stack in openstack of a UCloud job. getStackByName [jvm]fun getStackByName(stackName: String): Stack?Wrapper function to make mocking possible in unit testing getStackEvents [jvm]fun getStackEvents(stackName: String, stackIdentity: String): MutableList<out Event>? listFlavors [jvm]fun listFlavors(): List<Flavor?> listImages [jvm]fun listImages(filterParams: Map<String, String>): List<Image?> listServers [jvm]fun listServers(): List<Server?> listVolumes [jvm]fun listVolumes(): List<Volume> mapImage [jvm]fun mapImage(name: String, version: String, toolImage: String?): StringGiven a ucloud application name and version find the corresponding openstack image Since ucloud uses name and version and not a unique name/id we use this config mapping instead of a strict naming convention of images The config is also used to control which images are available monitorCreation [jvm]fun monitorCreation(job: Job)Monitor job and send status to ucloud when jobs are running or failed Polls openstack continually for the corresponding stack Based on the config, have a delay between each poll and a timeout to stop polling. When the job is found in a create complete state, send the output IP to ucloud in a job running update If this IP is not found or the stack isnt created within the timeout, send a job failed update monitorDeletion [jvm]fun monitorDeletion(job: Job)Monitor job and send status to ucloud when jobs are found in deleted state Polls openstack continually for the corresponding stack Based on the config, have a delay between each poll and a timeout to stop polling. When the job is found in a delete complete state, send the output IP to ucloud in a job success update If this IP is not found or the stack isn't created within the timeout, don't send status monitorInstance [jvm]fun monitorInstance(job: Job, expectedStatus: InstanceStatus) monitorShutdownInstanceSendUpdate [jvm]fun monitorShutdownInstanceSendUpdate(server: Server, job: Job, period: Long) monitorStartInstanceSendUpdate [jvm]fun monitorStartInstanceSendUpdate(server: Server, job: Job) monitorThreads [jvm]fun monitorThreads() prepareParameters [jvm]fun prepareParameters(job: Job): MutableMap<String, String>Prepare parameters for the stack template This parses ucloud application properties to a map that matches parameters in the stack template For now, there are some hardcoded parameters since we only use a single template removeFailedJobs [jvm]fun removeFailedJobs() resumeJobs [jvm]fun resumeJobs(jobs: List<Job>) resumeStack [jvm]fun resumeStack(stack: Stack) retrieveProducts [jvm]@Cacheable(value = ["products"])fun retrieveProducts(): List<ComputeSupport> retrieveUcloudJob [jvm]fun retrieveUcloudJob(ucloudId: String): Job? sendCreditDeficitUpdates [jvm]fun sendCreditDeficitUpdates() sendInstanceRestartedMessage [jvm]fun sendInstanceRestartedMessage(jobId: String)A shortcut function for sending job instance restart message sendInstanceShutdownAction [jvm]fun sendInstanceShutdownAction(server: Server) sendInstanceShutdownMessage [jvm]fun sendInstanceShutdownMessage(jobId: String, deficit: Double?)A shortcut function for sending job instance shutdown message sendInstanceStartAction [jvm]fun sendInstanceStartAction(server: Server) sendJobFailedMessage [jvm]fun sendJobFailedMessage(jobId: String, message: String)A shortcut function for sending job failed update message sendJobRunningMessage [jvm]fun sendJobRunningMessage(jobId: String, message: String)A shortcut function for sending job success update message sendJobStatusMessage [jvm]fun sendJobStatusMessage(jobId: String, state: JobState, message: String)This sends a JobsControlUpdateRequest to ucloud. suspendJobs [jvm]fun suspendJobs(jobs: List<Job>) suspendStack [jvm]fun suspendStack(stack: Stack) updateStackLastCharged [jvm]fun updateStackLastCharged(listStack: Stack, chargedAt: Instant): BooleanUpdate the lastCharged timestamp on a stack verifyJob [jvm]fun verifyJob(job: Job)Verify a jobs status matches the status of the corresponding stack in openstack If no stack found in openstack, assume deleted and send status update to ucloud verifyJobs [jvm]fun verifyJobs(jobs: List<Job>)

Start creation monitor function for each job in a list of jobs

The monitor function will send a status to UCloud when stack create is complete/failed

The monitor function will send a status to UCloud when stack is found in deleted status

docs.text: [jvm]\ fun asyncMonitorShutdownInstanceSendUpdate(server: Server, job: Job, period: Long)

docs.title: Async monitor start instance send update
asyncStackCreation
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun asyncStackCreation(job: Job, template: Template)

Parse parameters from the ucloud job, send parameters and template to openstack in a createStack request

Verification is done in order to detect missing required template parameters Verify that flavor, image and security group exists in openstack

If anything is missing, send a status update to ucloud with a job failed status.

For each stack in openstack, charge the corresponding job in ucloud.

docs.text: [jvm]\ fun chargeCreditsJob(jobId: String, lastChargedTime: String, cpuCores: Long, period: Long): ResourceChargeCreditsResponse

docs.title: chargeJob
docs.text: [jvm]\ fun chargeJob(job: Job, stack: Stack, instance: Server, period: Long, cpuCores: Int, newChargeTime: Instant)

docs.title: chargeStack
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun chargeStack(stack: Stack)

Charge stack by calling JobControl.chargeCredits

Get the corresponding job from ucloud to make sure it exists, return if not

Calculate the time amount to charge. This amount is the time between the lastCharged timestamp and now.

Maintain lastCharged for each stack as a tag on the stack in openstack. lastCharged is the moment the stack was charged last. The first time a stack is charged, use its creation time as lastCharged

docs.title: checkCreditsJob
docs.text: [jvm]\ fun checkCreditsJob(jobId: String, lastChargedTime: String, cpuCores: Long, period: Long): ResourceChargeCreditsResponse

docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun createStack(name: String, template: String, parameters: MutableMap<String, String>)

Send a stack creation request to openstack. Use the openstack4j builder to create the request and send it to openstack We don't return anything here because, since tasks are started to monitor the creation.

docs.title: createStacks
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun createStacks(jobs: List<Job>)

Start the process of creating stacks from ucloud jobs For now, we use a single template, but this can change in the future. For each job start an asynchronous task

docs.text: [jvm]\ fun createVolume(name: String, description: String, size: Int)

docs.title: deleteJob
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun deleteJob(job: Job)

Takes a job and finds the corresponding stack then sends a stack delete request to openstack.

First retrieve the stack based on the id on job then send delete request with id and name from job

docs.title: estimateProductPriceForPeriod
docs.text: [jvm]\ fun estimateProductPriceForPeriod(job: Job, period: Long): Double?

docs.title: getLastChargedFromStack
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun getLastChargedFromStack(stack: Stack): Instant

Retrieve lastCharged timestamp from stack in openstack

The timestamp is saved as a text tag on the stack and includes a prefix Get this timestamp, remove prefix and parse to Instant If timestamp not found, return creation timestamp from stack

docs.title: getStackByJob
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun getStackByJob(job: Job, includeDeleted: Boolean = false): Stack?

Retrieve corresponding stack in openstack of a UCloud job.

The stack name is the ucloud id prefixed based on config.

docs.title: getStackByName
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun getStackByName(stackName: String): Stack?

Wrapper function to make mocking possible in unit testing

docs.title: getStackEvents
docs.text: [jvm]\ fun getStackEvents(stackName: String, stackIdentity: String): MutableList<out Event>?

docs.title: mapImage
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun mapImage(name: String, version: String, toolImage: String?): String

Given a ucloud application name and version find the corresponding openstack image Since ucloud uses name and version and not a unique name/id we use this config mapping instead of a strict naming convention of images The config is also used to control which images are available

This above will be faced out when the a naming convention is implemented. New functionality All ucloud app names and versions can be mapped to a name of a openstack image using: ucloud-name-version Example: ucloudName: ubuntu, ucloudVersion: 20.04 will give the openstack name: "ucloud-ubuntu-20.04" We still need the id so get that from openstack

docs.title: monitorCreation
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun monitorCreation(job: Job)

Monitor job and send status to ucloud when jobs are running or failed Polls openstack continually for the corresponding stack Based on the config, have a delay between each poll and a timeout to stop polling. When the job is found in a create complete state, send the output IP to ucloud in a job running update If this IP is not found or the stack isnt created within the timeout, send a job failed update

docs.title: monitorDeletion
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun monitorDeletion(job: Job)

Monitor job and send status to ucloud when jobs are found in deleted state Polls openstack continually for the corresponding stack Based on the config, have a delay between each poll and a timeout to stop polling. When the job is found in a delete complete state, send the output IP to ucloud in a job success update If this IP is not found or the stack isn't created within the timeout, don't send status

docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun prepareParameters(job: Job): MutableMap<String, String>

Prepare parameters for the stack template This parses ucloud application properties to a map that matches parameters in the stack template For now, there are some hardcoded parameters since we only use a single template

A shortcut function for sending job instance restart message

A shortcut function for sending job instance shutdown message

A shortcut function for sending job failed update message

A shortcut function for sending job success update message

docs.title: sendJobStatusMessage
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun sendJobStatusMessage(jobId: String, state: JobState, message: String)

This sends a JobsControlUpdateRequest to ucloud.

docs.title: sendStatusWhenStackComplete
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun sendStatusWhenStackComplete(jobs: List<Job>)

Monitor a list of jobs and send status to ucloud when jobs are running or failed

For each job start an async task that polls openstack for the corresponding stack Based on the config, have a delay between each poll and a timeout to stop polling. When the job is found in a create complete state, send the output IP to ucloud in a job success update If this IP is not found or the stack isnt created within the timeout, send a job failed update

docs.title: updateStackLastCharged
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun updateStackLastCharged(listStack: Stack, chargedAt: Instant): Boolean

Update the lastCharged timestamp on a stack

The process is rather convoluted and subject to change. In order to change the tag we have to do a stack update. This requires the stack template.

Retrieve the template and remove the already saved ids. Create a stackUpdate and include the updated tag and the existing template and parameters

docs.title: verifyJob
docs.text:
[jvm]\ fun verifyJob(job: Job)

Verify a jobs status matches the status of the corresponding stack in openstack If no stack found in openstack, assume deleted and send status update to ucloud

If the stack status is different from expected send status update to ucloud.

docs.title: TemplateService

[jvm]\ @Service

class TemplateService(@Qualifier(value = "YAMLMapper")mapper: ObjectMapper)

This class contains utility functions for loading and verification of heat templates

docs.title: Jobs
docs.text:
[jvm]\ @Component

class Jobs(openStackService: OpenStackService)

This class contains the job that are run on a schedule

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Summary chargeAllStacks [jvm]@Scheduled(cron = "0 0,15,30,45 * * * *")fun chargeAllStacks()Starts the task that charges jobs in ucloud. This task is started every 15 minutes. cleanUpFailedStacks [jvm]@Scheduled(cron = "0 7 * * * *")fun cleanUpFailedStacks()Remove failed stack creations This task is started every hour. deleteNotChargedStacks [jvm]@Scheduled(cron = "0 0 3 * * *")fun deleteNotChargedStacks()Delete stacks with a shutoff instance that haven't been charged in x days This task is started every hour. emptyProductsCache [jvm]@CacheEvict(value = ["products"], allEntries = true)@Scheduled(cron = "0 0 3 * * *")fun emptyProductsCache() heartbeat [jvm]@Scheduled(cron = "0 0/5 * * * *")fun heartbeat()Sort of Heartbeat monitor that creates a log entry for splunk This task is started every 5 minutes. A "real" heartbeat should verify that the service is reachable, but yeah refreshProductsCache [jvm]@Scheduled(cron = "10 0 3 * * *")fun refreshProductsCache() sendCreditDeficitUpdates [jvm]@Scheduled(cron = "0 0 9 ? * MON")fun sendCreditDeficitUpdates()Sends an update about credit deficit to currently shutoff jobs This task is started every monday morning

docs.title: chargeAllStacks
docs.text:
[jvm]\

@Scheduled(cron = "0 0,15,30,45 * * * *")

fun chargeAllStacks()

Starts the task that charges jobs in ucloud. This task is started every 15 minutes.

@Scheduled(cron = "0 0 3 * * *")

docs.title: heartbeat
docs.text:
[jvm]\

@Scheduled(cron = "0 0/5 * * * *")

fun heartbeat()

Sort of Heartbeat monitor that creates a log entry for splunk This task is started every 5 minutes. A "real" heartbeat should verify that the service is reachable, but yeah
